name: LEGO® Star Wars™ - The Complete Saga
description: Kick Some Brick in I through VI! Play through all six Star Wars movies in one videogame! Adding new characters, new levels, new features and for the first time ever, the chance to build and battle your way through a fun Star Wars galaxy on your PC!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2/Vista Processor: Intel P3 1.0GHz or AMD Athlon XP or higher Memory: 156MB of RAM, 512MB required for Vista Graphics: 128MB Graphics card with Shader Model 2.0 Capability Hard Drive: 5GB of free space

reviews.review_text: Is it worth $20? For nostalgia's sake, yes... Definitely worth $6 on sale  And you learn that a true jedi's first priority is money

Surprisingly entertaining and consistently clever, LEGO Star Wars condenses the Star Wars saga into an abridged version that kids can enjoy, but it also provides hours of fun gameplay that will have you wanting more.
This gave me a huge rush of Nostalgia 10/10
a fun game it is.
You spend 90% of the time collecting studs. 10% of the time killing stormtroopers  10/10

LEGO Star Wars - The Complete Saga, takes the Original Trilogy of; A New Hope, The Empire Strikes Back, and Return of the Jedi, and combines it with; The Phantom Menace, The Clone Wars, and Revenge of the Sith. It was released in 2007. As is custom with LEGO games, you collect Gold Bricks to unlock additional content, collect coins to purchase things, and complete missions to further the story. A difference between the Complete Saga and the original LEGO Star Wars: The Video Game, are two previously deleted levels, The Bounty Hunter's Pursuit, and Anakin's Flight. These are unlockable by obtaining Gold Bricks.  As with many of the other LEGO games, Single Player Mode as well as Co-operative Two-Player mode is available locally. Having played this particular game on both the PS3, as well as PC, I can say I haven't seen any difference. If you enjoy the LEGO series, this is a must have for the collection. If you are new to LEGO games, LEGO Star Wars - The Complete Saga is a great place to start.
Played this game on PS2 when I was a lad, This port was done very well. plays exactly how it used too.
Lego= awesome. Star Wars= awesome. Lego + Star Wars= 2 awesome.   Lego Starwars is just 2 awesome.
*Whistles Star Wars theme*  I already played Lego Star Wars 1 & 2 on my GameCube and now I got the complete saga! Its wonderful to dive in into the lego world again.  11/10 would play again for sure.

Very fun game, it's everything that you would expect out of any LEGO game. The only complaint I have is that there are no achievements.  There is so much stuff packed into this game it's ridiculous. To complete the game to %100 will take you a while. Very much worth the money.
Taught me that a true jedi destroys property for money at every opportunity.
I just wanted to write this review to let you remind you that Lego Star Wars: The Force Awakens is being made.

By far my favorite lego game ive played to this oint im trying the lego movie and the hobbit next

This is a fun game but somewhat antiquated feeling if you've played the newer Lego games and then go back and play this. For those who may not know, this is a combination of 2 original titles - Lego Star Wars and Lego Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy. I have played neither of those but from my understanding, their recreation in this 'Complete Saga' is pretty faithful to the original games with some minor changes here and there. One of the nice bonus features is that they let you play the original version of 2 stages from the first game and you can tell that they definitely made some improvements in terms of the maneuvering and physics on those stages. However on one of the stages they also made it a lot easier by essentially removing certain goals that have to be met throughout the stage to continue.  On the whole thoguh, if you've played most any Lego game before, then you know what to expect. If not, then expect to smash a lot of stuff, play as a lot of different characters from the Star Wars series and use those characters' various abilities to progress through stages and find the insane amount of collectibles, if you so choose. As with most Lego games, this game goes almost overboard on the sheer amount content and collectibles that you have to play and find to achieve 100% if you're a completionist like me. This one really almost wore me down and I feel that they maybe put a bit TOO much, but you certainly get your money's worth.  All in all, if you're a Lego game fan and/or a Star Wars fan, I would recommend this game. It does a very good job of staying mostly faithful to the Star Wars movies, while taking some creative liberties in order to keep gameplay consistent. It also has the light-hearted humor throughout that the Lego games are known for and I think that Star Wars fans will appreciate most of it. Again though, be prepared for a slight feeling of antiquated controls and mechanics if you've played newer Lego games, sepcifically Lego Star Wars III: The Clone Wars because they have definitely continously made gameplay improvements over the years.
This was one of the best LEGO games I ever played and I had copies of the first movies on PSP and second series of movies on PS2. Reminds me on the old days I use to play on console.

My first lego game I really liked. It's fun, one of the first before the double trilogy games. It's basic, but fun, Lots of humor, works great, not many bugs. Probably one of the better lego games.   -There's no talking, which is a plus for me for lego games. Makes it feel like you're playing with legos. -Uses the hub system, so no open world like the newer lego games. -Hardly any bugs. Runs well. -Overuses the 'Scrolling Space Credit Opener' & Star Wars theme song for every single level.. For 24 levels, or 48 since you beat each level twice, plus bonus levels, So you'll get tired of both of em fast but you can skip so plus. -Fun game, simple, and long-ish. -Nice graphics, easy on the eyes.
fun for kids  classic/10
My childhood in a nutshell.
For those that enjoy the slapstick humor of Lego combined with classic Star Wars moments, I highly recommend this game!

Featuring all the usual Lego game features, most notably the humour, this game actually manages something that so many Star Wars based games fail to do... be an enjoyable game. In fact, if you were to overlook the lego connection you'll find this to be an excellent Star Wars game. I'm no Star Wars fanatic, but i have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this game to the most hardcore of SW fans as well as anyone who is looking for a fun game that doesn't take itself too seriously and is thoroughly absorbing as a result.

It includes Original and Prequal trilogies, back in the day they were completely seperate games. Being updated for PC is really nice, graphics look great, all the extras are cool. And you get so much out of this game.   Although if I had to mention some bad points, it's very easy to lose yourself in this game and realize hours later you've been playing for hours. Some of the musical score can get repedative and annoying.   Overall if you buy this game, it'll keep you occupied for countless hours, you'll have a bunch of fun, and feel like you've gotten more than your money's worth.

Wow, this game brings back so many memories. I probably played this game for 2-300 hours on my Playstation 2, and I remember having tons of fun playing levels over and over again with my siblings, and restarting because we didn't have a memory card. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who played as a kid, the nostalgia is awesome. I would also recommend you play with a controller, the keyboard is weird.

Brings back all the nostalgic feeling from when you were a kid if you had this game and is a nice game overall. The controls are a bit wierd but after an hour you get used to them and their not that bad. You can also change the controls yourself. I recommend this game to any Star Wars fan that wants to play through all of the movies, while having good fun doing so!
A good port. If you like LEGO and you like Star Wars you'll like this.       Plus you can make LEGO Leia dance ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

This used to be my favorite game many-a-year ago and I was afraid to return to it in fear that it would lose what had made it so entertaining for me. This game hasn't aged at all and I really did enjoy it. Before I knew it, I already had 3 hours logged on to the game! This game truly is one of if not the best Star Wars game you can buy. I've never reccomended another game as much as I can reccomend this one. I've logged over 200 hours on the DS version with less levels and features. This game includes many levels with puzzels that require different types of characters in order to get collectables and other objects in order to complete the game and to unlock secret areas and levels. Unlike other LEGO games, such as LEGO Indiana Jones, the puzzles are not tedious and not required for progression. Even with the game's cheat codes, the game is still as fun as ever and with no DLC, it is truly worth a buy.
my first love

The gameplay is pretty simplistic, and the graphics are somewhat primitive compared to the newer Lego games, but my 5yo son and I loved playing together. Some parts were a bit tricky for him, however, and I needed to help him out to complete a handful of levels.

A nostalgic compilation of two iconic video games that fueled the LEGO® licensed video game craze we see today. Playing LEGO® Star Wars™: The Complete Saga shows you how far Traveller's Tales has come in combining intellectual properties with a simple, well-loved childrens toy.

Here is the thing....this is a damn fun game.....I mean really really fun. However before I sing the praises let me bring up two huge issues for me. One is the A.I. it is utterly inept. You REALLY REALLY want to play with someone in co-op, as the A.I side kick does NOTHING. NO help of ANY kind while you fight. I am sure this is a result of wanting players to use the co-op feature. An that is my second issue. This really really is best served as a co-op play. You will enjoy it far more if you play with a friend, the wife, the hubby, the kids...anyone but the A.I. Now to recap the great here. All Star Wars films, the original 4,5,6 and the prequel 1,2, and 3. All here, all very in depth, insideously cute, and amazingly deep. The collectable got to get every Lego alone is a 100 to 150 hours alone. The reply value here is endless..... An for Any fan of Star Wars really needs to sit back, re enter the universe and do not be afraid to smile, and see it Lego style. Enjoy, I am.

I've played multiple hours of this game on co-op with a friend on his computer. It's on our youtube channel Dead Voxel Gaming. Horrible life choices aside, this game is g8 m8.  It's a lot of fun to play with a friend, especially if they are horrible at platforming.  It covers all the movies, which is why it is called the 'Complete Saga', but in this day on age you never know what you're getting (*cough* No Man's Sky *cough*) and the humor is genuine and reminds me of my childhood. And being an adult now I really don't want to think about now, I want to think about when I was much more innocent.  And it's Lego. Who doesn't love Lego? People who love Mega Blocks, the inbreds of society. Don't be someone who likes Mega Blocks. Get Lego Star Wars.  10/10

I never played the original LEGO Star Wars games when they first came out. Coming from having played some of the more recent LEGO games (LoTR, Marvel Superheroes), I can definitely see that the games have improved over the years.  Compared to the newer games, the easiest way to describe this game is annoying. There's a lot of endlessly respawning enemies in almost every level and not much you can do about them until you get to freeplay.  The hub world is cramped with no way to open the character roster to try out the characters you've unlocked without actually freeplaying a mission. Sometimes you can find the character you want wandering around the cantina if you get lucky. In freeplay, you have a tiny subset of your unlocked characters you can bring, of which all but 2 are chosen randomly so you probably won't get to play with your favorite characters.  Your AI controlled teammate does ZERO damage to enemies and is at best a distraction since the enemies focus almost exclusively on the player anyways. You're effectively punished for playing solo.  The difficulty (until you unlock cheats) is firmly on the side of annoying. The penalty for dying is minimal so it's not really difficult, but it's still not fun to be getting shot at by a dozen different enemies focused exclusively on you, interrupting you left and right and killing you frequently until you do whatever is needed to stop the respawns or move to the next area. On the other hand, the auto deflect cheat with exploding blaster bolts is immensely satisfying once unlocked.  Vehicle missions are awful. Controls are terrible, and there's way too much running back and forth through endlessly respawning swarms of enemies to pick up torpedoes or (even worse) tow a bomb to a target.  There's a lot more content reuse (game time is padded with an extra challenge mode for each level where you can't use extras) but it still counts towards 100% completion.  There's a very annoying bug where the game effectively freezes for a few seconds every once in awhile. This is on a modern PC with dedicated graphics and a SSD.  Much of this is forgiveable (except for the bugs) since this is simply a remastered version of the games that started this (mostly) wonderful collection of TellTale LEGO games. The newer games have improved upon these issues, and the newer games with the huge overworlds are surprisingly fun open world games.  I can recommend this game based on the humor and for anyone who wants to complete their LEGO game collection, but unless you've got some seriously strong rose colored glasses on the gameplay falls short compared to the newer games.

If you feel like a child, do it. I played it a lot as a kid and this is a very good port, so take what you will from the original version if you played it. It's not a great game by any means but it's quite hilarious, the puzzles are a bit easy and most of the platforming is mindless, but shooting lego minifigures with backwards megaphones and watching them disassemble is always cute. Other than being ironic it's not worth grabbing but if you want to, I'd say why not.

Cut-n-copy from my review of Lego Marvel Avengers as this game has the same issues:( ----------------------- If you like the Lego gamescape you'll like this title. I highly recommend getting a game controller for the PC version as the keyboard setup is cumbersome to say the least. And there is NO advantage in buying thise title if you own the console version!  At first I was happy to see 'Local COOP', as in other games (not Lego) Local COOP had usually meant LAN-locked connectivity. However, disappointment reigned as my son and I discovered 'Local COOP' really means, shared keyboard or multiple game controllers used on ONE computer.  Had high hopes we could play drop-in-style as a family or with friends using either our laptops or desktops wherever we were comfortable at home or away:(   So, I'm rating this a thumbs down on that one hangup as otherwise I'd have saved the cost of buying multiple copies and just stayed with the console version.

Pros: Legos! Star Wars! They managed to make Star Wars and Legos boring!  Cons: Clunky combat. It's just not fun to fight anything Bland uninspired level design Laughably easy difficulty Not much feedback is given as to what is going on. It's like playing some obtuse old NES game  Lego Star Wars can easily be summed up in one word. Boring. This game makes me feel nothing other then absolute tedium. If you want a Star Wars title look elsewhere.
lago games are for babbies, i bouight this game for my 38 year old son, and i thouhgt he woulld enjoy it, but this game is made for ♥♥♥♥ING BABIES, IT IS SO BORING AND NO DIFFFICULY AT ALL

By far the worst LEGO game I've played so far. First of all I noticed that there are no voice acting whatsoever, which confuses me since TT games apparently got a license to do these games but couldn't get a licence for the voices (for example in LEGO Lord of the Rings and LEGO The Hobbit).  Second the controls when playing as a LEGO man is good but if you're in a flying vehicle then it's just frustrating hard and third but not least the boss battles are nothing but annoying.  Luckily I got this game dirtcheap on a Steam sale, otherwise I would've been really annoyed.

utter garbage. blatantly the beginner to the lego series. every mechanic is designed to needlesly take up as much as possible.   the lego series has improved overtime but this is a definite skip. about 6 hours of gameplay with very light humor, with about 20 hours of grinding for no reward.

It's just so much simpler this way. All the others are way too advanced, too many controls and in-game chores. This is Lego Star Wars at its best.

LEGO Star Wars one of, if not THE most popular LEGO theme to have ever existed. Oh and we've got one more thing to tell you it's now a game, rather two separate games. What if we told you we'd rolled both of those games into one single package with even more bonus features then great. You should really think about picking this one up if you like LEGO and Star Wars. It has Co-op so if a friend comes over there's always something for you to do and it's LEGO what more should I say.
this is a great game.

My short reveiw may not mean a whole lot since I haven't really played the game all that much, but, I will go ahead and say that I have really enjoyed this game so far. If you like the other lego series games then you will almost certainly enjoy this one. It's not as good as The Hobbit or The Lord of the Rings games (in my opinion) but it's still really enjoyable. It's nice to have levels with some of the vehicles in it and be able to have the ship battles. My biggest complaint out of the entire game would have to be the lightsaber combat. It feels really slow and clunky. Not really sure what could be done to change that but that part gets kind of annoying every once in a while. Other than that, I think the game is excellent.

Fun game for all ages and especially those who like Lego and StarWars fans. Like most Lego games has aged well and Lego is Lego and looks always like Lego. SImple platformer that will not hurt your brain with it's puzzles, get it for a bit of mindless Lego fun. Perfect for parents to play with their kids.  On another note: If you own a PC, then you should have a controller. Not every game is made with keyboard and mouse in mind. Do you play racing games and Mortal Kombat style fighters with your keyboard and mouse? About the only games desgined for K/M are FPS and hidden picture games :p  Heck you can grab a cheap knockoff 360 wired controller on Ebay for $10AUD. (approx $7USD) If you already own a wireless 360 cobntroller then buy a cheap wireless dongle instead.  If you downvote this or any other game because you're too cheap to own a controller or do not know your Xbox 360's wired controller will plug straight into yourWindows PC then you're an idiot who needs to hand in their Master Race card.  If a review is ever negative because it requires a controller ignore it. Nothing worng with the games, the problem is those using them.

These two games started the current Licensed 'Travelers Tales formula' and they execute it the best (also you dont have to beat the game to access freemode, or listen to awful jokes by the characters Im looking at you Lego Batman 2)   Which one is better?  Lego Starwars 2 has better humour, not just in cutscenes but the general enviroment is jam packed with outrageousness. The stages also feel more refined then Lego Starwars 1, there definitely aren't as many bs deaths either.    Battle Mechanics and Gameplay  Sadly this is the weakest aspect of the game, it has the simplicity of an early one button beat em up. Some characters are capable of doing more then just mashing the attack button, such as a rolling and then rapid fire or a force blast with a swipe. But for the most part the battling is weak, fights are usually short lived due to enemy HP being so fragile. If you're playing solo great ready to watch your AI partner never kill or assist you in a boss fight. They'll pretend they doing something (such as blocking or purposely shooting to the side of the enemy) but they're programmed to never kill... for whatever reason.  Sound  You can hate this entire game all you want but the soundtrack is spectactular. It's straight out of the movies.   Choice  Character variety is huge and I'm not talking about just character models. I would say there are different groupings of characters and each group has something that sets it apart from each other (Droids, Sithlords, Bounty Hunters, Troopers, Jedi, Indiana Jones. Rebels, YOUR CUSTOM CHARACTER(S), Lulzy characters, Misceclanous characters). Even in these groups almost every character is unqiue in some manner.    Stage Design  For those who have seen the series you will have no trouble recnogizing every piece of secenery, with a hint of Lego humour invovled. Bonus items are well placed and at times incredibly cryptic. The puzzles are basic at times and actually challenging at others (suprising if you've played other TT Lego games...).   Replabitlity  You will find yourself going back to a stage 2 or 3 times (especially for the Hoth Battle, Deathstar Run and Speeder Bike stages). Or you could play straight forward through the story and replay the free modes to 100%.

Loved these games when I was a kid, but as I grew up I thought about them, and realized how pointless and repetitive the gameplay was.  Then I bought this game during a christmas sale and realized it's freaking great. I swear i will never get tired of running to grab that blue stud. Or switching off the emperor at the last second to get a super jump. Or removing C3PO's limbs so he has to hop around and hit panels with his face. Or the glorious sound the minikit makes when you pick it up.  10/10 Would screen-tug again.

Lego Star Wars the Complete Saga is a fun game. The missions / levels can be beat relatively quickly if you don't bother with the collectables. Collecting things in the game actually serve a purpose besides 100% completion.  +36 missions / levels +All missions are based on parts of the Star Wars movies (1-6) +Graphics / artwork look nice +Very replayable +Dozens of characters to play as +Supports two players on the same computer +Controller support +You can customize two characters how you like +Lots of stuff to collect on each level  -Gameplay can get repetitive after a few play throughs -No mouse support (camera is controlled by the game) -Very minimal graphic options -No achievements (console versions included them)
This is best of the Lego games before every movie and it's mother had a Lego game made for it. Does a good job of making fun of all the movies in a light-hearted way.
i have spent countless hours on this game on my ds lite or wii ahh those were the good old days  now i have it on pc so yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay

The only problem i encountered was in chapter 1 of Episode 6. the game somehow glitches because it won't let me through a door that was supposed to open automatically. So i can't play any of Episode 6 :(  Other than that, I give this game a 8/10

I've been playing this game with my kids, and it can be a lot of fun. The puzzles are largely intuitive, and with a few awkward exceptions (like Dagobah), it's pretty straightforward to figure out what to do next. The combat is pretty easy but fun, perfect for running with kids. We're enjoying it for the most part.  However, local co-op mode has a lot of problems with it. It's very easy to accidentally drag your partner off of a cliff by moving in the wrong direction. Several chapters, like the pod race, require both players to play perfectly. Basically, the game is actually much *harder* as a local co-op game than as a single-player game, which basically defeats the purpose of local co-op. Often, we'll just have one person drop out when a section becomes especially hard to do with two people.

God damn, I finally found it (even though I didn't really search for it. Nostalgia is too real here, this game is a masterpiece.  On another note! To anyone who as mad because the game don't work with controllers, download 'MotioninJoy'! I was about to go and cry in a corner when I thought I had to play the game by keyboard, which would be awful, but if you download that application you can play with either your x360/xbox one controller or ps3/4 controller, and you'll be able to experience the nostalgia the way you should!

this game is pretty good but keep in mind it isn't canon anymore under disney so none of the characters are in the real star wars. no obi wan. no luke. no indiana jones.  pros: kinect is responsive, great motion capture in the cutscenes, cars go fast, 2 lego city levels cons: no dexter jettster, no newt gunray, no kylo ren, too many sections w/ infinite enemy spawns, death has no weight, I will never be a child again, episode iv just copies a new hope beat for beat and doesn't do anything original with the star wars license  I give it a 5 out of 6 on the rosenthal scale.

Lego Star Wars is a game I consider a classic from my childhood and the Star Wars VII hype got me to pick up this game in the Winter sale (Damn you marketing tactics!). This doesn't mean I think it's one of the best games I ever played as a kid but it's one I have very fond memories of and pretty much anyone I talk to about it has played it at some point. It's that perfect blend of co-op, collectathon, movie tie-in that's just great to play when I'm not feeling something very intense and just want to relax.   The game is most certainly flawed, the artificial difficulty and lack of any complex combat is the one of the big complaints; I never felt challenged playing this game but I also died a lot because the game throws enemies at you non stop and while they only take one hit to kill avoiding all the blaster bolts can prove annoying if you aren't a character with auto dodge. This really slows down the game and while I don't expect the most from the combat every lightsaber battle was jump attack, jump attack, jump attack ect. It's impossible to hit someone while they're blocking with anything other than the air attacks which are undodgeable by the AI if you're in range. I know this is a kids game and not meant to be challenging but after a while even kids would find this tedious at best.  The lack of online co-op is my biggest grind with this game. At first I thought it was an issue with it being such an old game that relies on single screen co-op but after checking other Lego games I realized that it was nothing more than a trend of laziness. I did manage to take my laptop to a friend's and play it with them and it was great fun except that save files are harder than needs be to locate and impossible to get working on a separate machine to the one it came from meaning we had to start a fresh with none of the cool characters I'd unlocked. Besides some of the vehicle levels being a bit lackluster and Superstory being total BS and a lazy way to recycle content these are my only real complaints with the game so from here on out it's all positive.   The Lego formula has practically been perfected now but that doesn't mean it wasn't always great. Star Wars has so much charm in its cutscenes and is very humoresque due to it's recognizable and lovable characters acting out the Star Wars story in a silly and joking way. There is so much to do in this game and so much to find. While some levels practically hand you the collectibles some can prove a real challenge to find, but if your smart you can aim to collect the stud multipliers and minikit/red brick detector red bricks giving you a hint on in which direction there is a collectible. There's also some extra game modes in the complete saga that add that make 100%ing this game a real journey as you try collect all the gold bricks.  One of the best things about Lego Star Wars is that it's well, Star Wars. Playing all your favourite Jedi battle it out on all those great planets from the Star Wars universe is immensely entertaining and even more fun in Lego. I would enjoy this game even if it wasn't Star Wars but the real heart and charm of the game comes from seeing your favorite scenes re-acted in Lego form.   There were dull moments while playing this game but I thoroughly enjoyed it and I felt both a sense of fulfillment and emptiness once I reached 100% which shows just how great this game is. May the force be with you all.

Prior to just buying this game on PC I had only ever played the game once before, on the PS2, one of the best hours ive spent playing a game, 2 player coop is great. why didnt i buy this game when i first got steam

A simple yet beautiful game that retells Star Wars in a cute, humorous LEGO way. Easy jump-in-and-out co-op makes the game even more enjoyable. Short and sweet levels (some are longer, just to mix it up) with plenty of collectables to keep you interested in replay value without making it feel like a chore.

If you've liked any other LEGO game you'll like this one too.  The game mechanics haven't changed too much, you solve puzzles, fight some guys and progress in the level. Even though you know story, the LEGO characters give it a special touch.  Furthermore, for the completionists out there this game has many hidden treasures and extra levels to complete which makes this a really cool game to me.
This game is great but since it doesnt have voices u cant understand the story so i recomend watching the movies before playing this game but only if u just wanna play for fun

Best game ever to play with your (girl)friend.  Has full controller support (xbox 360) and is challenging without being too difficult and you'll still be able to have fun.  11/10 would play again.

I have many childhood memories of playing this game on the ps2, not particulary ( The Complete Saga ) but i had the first and the second game on disk and finished both games multiple times. Im gonna try to review this game without notsagia in mind... this game is a realease of the first two games combined into one game called the ( Complete Saga )  it's a ok enjoyable experience, if you have never played this game and your over the age of 13-15 this game will most likely not be that fun. I do recommend this game for kids that are just getting into video games and also like movie's like Starwars. This game is more for a casual audience with easy to understand controls and simple levels. It has many diffrent colectibles like character's, powerup's and stud's or coins. This game also supports two players and with the price tag of $20 its a great game for starwars lovers and first time gamer's. 7/10
